borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
<p> The proposal, by reason of siting and scale, would be an
     undesirable addition which would cause unacceptable loss of daylight, sunlight and outlook to neighbouring dwellings, resulting in a harmful impact to the amenity currently enjoyed by
     neighbouring occupiers. The proposal thus fails to
     accord with the following policies which seek to ensure that development
     proposals protect residential amenity:
</p><ul><li> Paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy
     Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, September 2023)</li><li> Policy D6 of the London Plan (March 2021)
</li><li> Policies&nbsp;BP8 and BP11 of the&nbsp;Local Development
     Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)
</li><li> Sections 4, 5.3 and 5.4 of the Residential Extensions and
     Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)
</li><li> Policies DMD1 and DMD6 of&nbsp;The London Borough of Barking
     and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version,
     December 2021)
</li></ul>

<p>The
proposal, by reason of siting, mass, scale, bulk and design, would be an
undesirable addition which would fail to pay regard to the design of the existing house and fail to appear subservient to the original dwelling, resulting&nbsp;in an overly dominant appearance, particularly when considering the cumulative impact of the proposed extensions.&nbsp;As such, it fails to respect or reflect the character of the original
dwelling, the terrace row of which it forms a part, and the surrounding area,
causing harm to each of these.&nbsp;The proposal thus fails to accord with the
following policies which seek to ensure development proposals are well
designed, respect and reflect the existing character:
</p><ul><li>

 Paragraph
     130 of the National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, September 2023)
</li><li> Policy&nbsp;D4&nbsp;of
     the London Plan (March 2021)</li><li>
 Policies
     CP2 and CP3 of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy
     (July 2010)
</li><li> Policies&nbsp;BP8
     and BP11 of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide
     Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)
</li><li> Sections
     4, 5.3 and 5.4 of the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary
     Planning Document (February 2012)
</li><li> Policies
     SP2 and DMD6 of&nbsp;The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft
     Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)
</li></ul>
description: Construction of a single storey part rear/side extension and first floor part rear and side extension, front porch and Hip-to-gable roof extension to accommodate a rear Dormer extension including two roof lights to the front to facilitate conversion of roof space into habitable accommodation. Demolition of existing two outbuildings and construction of a single outbuilding.
